FuncDef:
The loop-detect eth-loop precise-block trust-port command configures an interval at which a trusted interface is generated for the local device.
The undo loop-detect eth-loop precise-block trust-port command restores the default interval.
By default, the interval at which a trusted interface is generated is 600s.
CLIs: undo loop-detect eth-loop precise-block trust-port generate-time

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interval at which a trusted interface is generated.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 2000000, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a dynamic MAC address entry remains the same in the MAC address table within a specified period and is not deleted, in a scenario where accurate blocking policy is enabled. The outbound interface in the MAC address entry is trusted. To configure an interval at which a trusted interface is generated, run the loop-detect eth-loop precise-block trust-port command.
Precautions
Trusted interfaces are changeable and the latest trusted interfaces are used. To ensure the correctness of trusted interfaces, specify the interval at which trusted interfaces are generated to a period shorter than the aging time of dynamic MAC address entries
